title: Gangplank Early Game, Q Farm or Harass? HELP ME
body: So, I've been trying to main Gangplank for a while now ever since I saw a video of Gangplank insta killing a full HP Vayne with a single Q, and now he has a rework coming and it looks like he might finally be balanced with his new E. I really like him, but I have not yet carried a game with him, most of the time I feed or lose lane and I'm quite sure its because of how passive I am with Gangplank. I start off with {{item:2041}} 1 {{item:2003}}  and 2 {{item:2004}} and just farm with my Q (Parrrley). I never engage or harass unless my team is heading top for a gank even though about 95% of the time, the enemy top laner focuses on me more than farming. The reason I do this is because I think Q farming will benefit me more than just harassing and trying to win lane. Whats your guys opinions on this?

replies.body:
Q is used as required, there are two ways to play it, veigar-esque in your manner.
You can commit to harrass and have a decent laning phase, or commit to farm and have a passive laning phase, it's that simple! 

Playstyle is the real answer, depending on who you're against or how you play really dictates the nature of the question.

That video was of "crit-plank" more than likely and Critplank is not a good idea. Its fun, but not that good to play in ranked.

I woulodn't worry about him until you the rework pops out.

What i used to do with GP was, if they are melee or had little to no sustain, I would harass. However if its like a Malphite with Flask 3 pots or a Riven with cloth+5 and keeps shielding the Q, I wouldnt bother.
With the rework, you basically 100% want to farm with your Q.
